responses.rationale: The segment reports factual information about reported infections without using bare negation or calming cues.
The segment states results are pending, which is not a bare negation.
The segment reports test results (inconclusive/positive) without using bare negation.
The segment reports an infection and monitoring without using bare negation.
The segment states a higher risk for certain individuals, which is not a bare negation.
The segment contains the bare negation 'have shown no unusual activity' without an explicit calming cue.
The segment contains a bare negation ('does not change') but it is followed by an explicit calming cue ('risk to the general public remains low').
The segment reports a past case detection without using bare negation.
The segment reports previous cases and symptoms without using bare negation.
The segment reports previous cases without using bare negation.
The segment reports contact, symptoms, treatment, and recovery without using bare negation.
The segment reports an infection and contact without using bare negation.
The segment reports an infection without using bare negation.
The segment reports securing vaccine doses, which is not a bare negation.
The segment contains an explicit calming cue ('risk... is considered to be low') and is not a bare negation without calming.
The segment contains the bare negation 'There are no active cases' without an explicit calming cue.
The segment contains the bare negation 'there have been no confirmed human-to-human transfers' without an explicit calming cue.
The segment contains explicit calming cues related to monitoring and ensuring access to vaccines, not a bare negation without calming.
